pages.text: An API giving access to $(l:norabotics:commands)commands$().$(br)$(bold)amount()$() -> amount of selected commands$(br)$(bold)getAvailableCommands()$() -> a list of available commands as strings$(br)$(bold)get()$() -> the list of currently selected $(l:norabotics:programming/command_api#command_object)commands$()$(br)$(bold)remove(i)$() -> the command at index i. Removes it from the active commands

$(bold)add(type, ...)$() - add a command of specified type. See getAvailableCommands for a list of available commands. See $(l:norabotics:programming/command_api#command_object)here$() for argument formats

pages.title: Command Object
pages.text: $(bold)getType() -> a string representation of this command's type$()$(br)$(bold)getSelections()$() -> a list of string representations of the argument selections$(break)$(bold)setSelection(i, selection)$() - Set the selection at index i. Parsing rules are:$(li)items, blocks, entity types are looked up with their id, e.g. minecraft:cobblestone$(li)entity searches are cast as searches by name

$(li)positions are required to be in the format 'x y z' or 'dimension-id x y z'. The Vanilla dimension ids are: overworld, the_nether & the_end. You can find out the id of the dimension you are currently in by hitting F3.
